ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hi, I am new
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah, I have been acting more social around people, I even helped power level a beastmaster for an hour and and made some money. ... From: Su To:
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah, I have been acting more social around people, I even helped power level a beastmaster for an hour and and made some money.
----- Original Message -----
From: Su
To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, April 05, 2002 8:39 PM
Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hi, I am new

Ah. That's why you make friends. Group with some people. Make sure to play
nice. Ask others for advice. Find some people you really like hanging with
and put them on friends list. Then if you see them on contact them. Find out
if you can hang out with people who seem to get along with you really well.
No stalking though. :-)
I have friends that I met in the game who like to group with me or help me
out. I help them out. A guild is a wonderful thing as well. My guildies and
I like to get together and hang out. It's fun. :-)
luv,
-Su

I don't know it is hard to say. I am just not very good at most of the
aspects of EQ like camping items and meeting people to play with. I tend to
just go where everyone else my level is and join pickup groups. I hate
playing alone. It just seems like the game would be ten times better if you
had a group of friends to play with.
  ----- Original Message -----
  From: Su
  To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
  Sent: Thursday, April 04, 2002 7:16 AM
  Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Hi, I am new


  Welcome back to EQ!
  I've been playing EQ since September of 2000 or so. I obviously enjoy
  playing. :-) I'm not sure exactly what kind of advice you're asking for
  here. Anything specific you need to know about?
  luv,
  -Su

  Hi, I bought Everquest the first day it came out. I am not a very good EQ
  player. I would consider myself ultra competent in group battles, but in
  other aspects of the game I am decidedly mediocre. I have never gotten a
  character past level 40. My first character was an Erudite Enchanter by
the
  name of Helion Blightermind. I eventually got to level 40 after two years
or
  so. I also have a level 40 Gnome Wizard which was my friends character but
I
  own it. I just started playing again after giving up on the game and
playing
  DAOC. Eventually I gave up all MMORPGS deciding they were a waste of time.
  About a week ago, I decided to give EQ another chance and have decided
that
  it has improved a great deal. I am now playing a Human Ranger who is level
  30. I really like the character. His buffs and damage spells are great. I
  guess I could use some help on how to be a good EQ player. I have been
  playing for about two years and I feel like I know absolutely nothing
about
  the game. I have never belonged to a good guild or anything. I play on the
  Xegony server.
